main event: A ground-radar observation was made in December 1957 in La Madera, New Mexico, involving a round object the size of a basketball, moving at high speed from side to side at 5 feet in altitude.
interesting points: The object was described as round, the size of a basketball, with bright white light.
It was observed moving at high speed from side to side at 5 feet in altitude.
The report noted the lack of information and stated that determination was impossible.
The document mentioned the object at 45 degrees elevation in the South.
sighted object: round object the size of a basketball, moving at high speed from side to side at 5 feet in altitude
